data.title: Hometown Cafe
data.text: I had the French dip sandwich with fries. Sandwich was excellent, fries limp. (I prefer crispier fries) Service friendly and quick. Good menu with a lot of choices. Serves Breakfast, lunch & dinner. They're breakfast is pretty good also.

data.title: Small town diner, small town bar
data.text:
I've been to both the diner and the bar at this restaurant and both have a pretty comfortable, if a little grimy, small town feel to them.  Of the two, I prefer the diner, especially for breakfast.  Their breakfasts are reasonably priced and very tasty.  Totally okay to split breakfast as there's tons of food.  Their menu is utterly unsurprising but if you're looking for some old standards, they make them pretty good here.  The service is charming, the servers are just very real people who will chat with you and the conversations you hear are usually pretty amusing.  The old pictures of Auburn on the wall are awesome, I love looking at them. 

Every time I've gone to the bar there has been very loud karaoke or some other live music.  The bar is small so the volume makes conversation totally impossible. There are usually extremely drunk patrons there, but they've been well behaved.  We usually grab a drink and end up fleeing the noise right away.

data.title: Rainbow Cafe
data.text: It's is a cute little diner style restaurant. We went for breakfast and the food was great. Service was good once they got to us and gave us menus(seemed like they just got over a rush when we walked in) they had a lounge but we didn't walk back to check it out, some pull tabs up front so I assume more in the lounge. It's a nice place to try.

data.title: We were starving
data.text: Walked in at about 2 pm on Saturday on our way to the Oregon Coast.  We were starving.  We were looking for soup and sandwiches. There was a good choice for deli sandwiches.  There is a special : half a sandwich and a cup of soup for just a little over $5.00. If o would have known how large the sandwiches were I would have gotten that.  I did get a whole sandwich with a cup of the best coleslaw.  I could only eat half the sandwich.  My husband had sandwich and clam chowder.  He really liked the chowder. The waitress was very friendly and very fast. We were very happy with our visit. I would recommend having lunch at The Rainbow Cafe.

data.title: Delicious breakfast. Interesting people, eclectic vibe
data.text: The breakfast here is always delicious. My husband gets the Eggs Benedict every time and I usually get the basic everyday eggs and hashbrowns with toast. It is consistently good. The prices are reasonable, but the service isn't great. Not sure if they're always having a bad day or what, but for a long time the same people worked there and now there's a new group, so I'm not sure if it changed management or what. The parking situation leaves much to be desired as it is difficult to find parking on the street or behind the building. The Irish Coffee is yummy and strong, no skimping here. They do breakfast up right. You can play pull tabs or check your Lotto tickets here, if you need to and there's a bar in the back if you get a hankerin' for some pinball or a different view. Every time we come here, it's always busy.

data.title: Good eats
data.text: Located downtown, eclectic environs and good food.  Special focus on filling and tasty breakfasts.  A real treat for after the Auburn Theater.

data.title: Grear meeting room
data.text: I have been here for a number of different types of meeting. Always friendly staff and good food. The most convenient location in the city.

data.title: Best Breakfast in Auburn
data.text: I could care less what the other reviews tell you about where to eat for breakfast in Auburn.  I live here and I've eaten at all the other top rated breakfast spots.  This one has been consistently the best breakfast I've eaten in Auburn.  It's served all day long for starters.  The cook is an Italian guy who also owns the joint.  The prices are reasonable, the portions are ample while the quality is excellent.  I'm going to go out on a limb here and stomp my foot and say that this is consistently the best value and best breakfast in Auburn.

data.title: Good sized meal for the prize
data.text: Good down home cooking, always has regulars there, so that says something good about a restaurant. We went there on the recommendation of my sister, even though we live about one mile due east, never thought about it as a place to have breakfast. Ate lunch there years back. Is an Auburn institution.

data.title: Good basic food downtown Auburn
data.text:
Breakfast menu is  comprehensive; very good Blueberry pancakes, eggs cooked to order present well and are tasty; Asked for fruit side in lieu of home fries-was fresh cut-up fruit and very good. Seervice very good and friendly

Would get a higher rating except for the coffee.  it is almost a sin not to have great coffee in the Seattle metro area.  Coffee here is barely just average and an opportunity to improve.

data.title: Found this place by accident, not real impressed
data.text: I was looking for a particular restaurant nearby I saw on Trip Advisor and stopped at this one by accident. The food at best could be called average but the level of service brought the review down another notch. They weren't busy at the time so there is really no explanation. I wanted some kind of sauce to do something with the bland hashbrowns but couldn't get the servers attention before they got cold so I ate what I could as they were. Sausage (patty style) again was just average. I'll try harder to find the one I intended to go to.

data.title: awesome sandwhiches
data.text: I often take the wife and my son there because she loves the hot sandwiches, and he loves the generous helping of fries. The burgers are pretty good as well. Havent eaten much else there, but what I have had has been pretty good.

data.title: new owner-better food
data.text: My past experiences with the Rainbow had been mediocre at best.  But I had brunch there last weekend & it was much better.  The employees were smiling & friendly.  The food was good.  My husband & I got a skillet with chicken fried steak & a strawberry waffle & we shared them.  We will definitely come again.

data.title: Great breakfast - consistently good
data.text: We've been going to the Rainbow for years frequently.  Their breakfast selections are always great and they have very good soups daily.  My husband loves their Yakamush - a combination of hash browns, eggs, onion, cheese and bacon.  They serve large portions - plenty to take home and have an additional meal.  All of the waitresses are very nice and attentive.  It's always a pleasure to go here.
